medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset of central abdominal pain
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced acute onset of central abdominal pain starting at 6 PM the previous evening. The pain kept her awake all night, and in the morning, she went to her primary care physician (PCP), who referred her to the emergency department (ED). The patient reports some nausea and bloating, with pain still located in the central lower abdomen but more pronounced in the right lower quadrant (RLQ). She denies prior history of similar symptoms and no accompanying fever, chills, vomiting, shortness of breath, chest pain, or diarrhea.
